name: einkorn
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a very old type of wheat (= a grain used for making flour) with red grains, grown especially in southeast Europe and southwest Asia, often as food for animals: Einkorn is one of the oldest cultivated grains known to man. The frequent rain and mild conditions allowed farmers to grow rye, lentils and einkorn wheat.
More examplesFewer examplesEinkorn was probably first grown by farmers in a small region of south-east Turkey.Einkorn grows with a protective husk on the grain, which makes it more difficult to mill.Archaeologists have found seeds of domesticated einkorn wheat that are thousands of years old.Einkorn flour is becoming popular because it is easy to digest.
